comments:
Receive error when trying to use JSP Editor to edit a .jsp file.  I only receive
this error since upgrading to newest .7 version.

The error I receive is: Unable to create this part due to an internal error.
Reason for the failure: The editor class could not be instantiated. This usually
indicates that the editor's class name was mistyped in plugin.xml.

It looks like your install has become corrupted somehow as .jsp files should be
loading the org.eclipse.jst.jsp.ui.internal.provisional.StructuredTextEditorJSP
class.  Upgrading from one version of WTP to another so far has required the
removal of the previous version first since the version number was downgraded
from 1.0 to 0.7 during development.  Installing WTP with the Update Manager when
another version of WTP is already installed will not work properly.

Troy, please try a fresh install and see if this error goes away. 
Alternatively (or in addition to) please attach your configuration/log files
(available from the "about" box). I'm interested in those particularly because
I'm wondering if you might have other plugins or tools installed, that might be
a factor? Please do not hesitate to re-open if a fresh install does not help.

This bug is being moved to the 'closed' state since it has been in the 'remind' state for a so long it is assume it is no longer a problem or otherwise not a useful bugzilla entry. 

If this semi-automatic processing is in error, please re-open, or open another bug.
Reopening, in order to put into a valid closed state as remind is now deprecated, and closed, remind, does not make much sense.

Resolving as won't fix, as these had previously been closed out, if this is incorrect, please provide more data and reopen.

Thanks,
